resources.string: Thank you for participating in the BATO study!
The aim of this app is to help people build the skills that researchers find helpful in feeling good.
Know the activities you do that make you feel good (or bad), and know the thoughts you think that make you feel good (or bad).
The ability to challenge negative thoughts
You will build these skills through a daily diary, daily mood graphs, the "Nab the Negative" and the "Destroyer Game".
write a positive thought to destroy the negative thought
Create a thought that challenges the truth of this negative thought.

If you were trying to act as your own attorney whose job was to defend yourself, and whether or not you went to jail depended on the truth of this negative thought, what would you say in your own defense?
If your friend called very upset and said this thought about himself/herself, what would you say to him/her?
How would this thought make you feel?
How much do you believe this thought
You assume what others think about you.
You predict the future will be negative.
You believe that, if something bad happens, it will be awful and unbearable.
You put negative lables on yourself and others.
You only think about the bad side of things.
You claim that the positive things you do are not important.
You think about things in black-and-white terms. E.g., good or bad, all or none.
You make conclusions about how things are based on one event.
You blame yourself for negative events.
You view things in term of how they "should" be, now how they are.
You compare yourself to others doing better than you.

See if the negative thought you entered corresponds to any of these common types of negative thinking. If it does, drag and drop it in to the correct train, so it can be sent of the Tip the Scales Game, and later the Destroyer Game, where you will destroy the negative thought!
See if the negative thought you entered corresponds to any of these common types of negative thinking.

string-array.item: You assume what others think about you.
You predict the future will be negative.
You believe that if something bad happens it will be awful and unbearable.
You put negative labels on yourself and others.
You only think about the bad side of things.
You claim that the positive things you do are not important.
You think about things in black-and-white terms; e.g., good or bad, all or none.
You make conclusions about how things are based on one event.
You blame yourself for negative events.
You view things in term of how they "should" be, not how they are.
You compare yourself to others doing better than you.

resources.string: To unlock this game, populate your diary with daily thoughts!
To unlock this game, play \'Tip the Scales\' to generate challenging thoughts!
